ns0:Resource.title: VHS DR2 - VISTA Hemisphere Survey Data Release 2

curation.publisher: WFAU, Institute for Astronomy, University of Edinburgh

creator.name: WFAU, Institute for Astronomy, University of Edinburgh

content.subject: Stars,Survey,Galaxy, low mass stars, dark energy
content.description: The VHS will image the entire ~20 000 square degrees of the Southern Sky, with the exception of the areas already covered by the VIKING and VVV surveys, in J and Ks. The resulting data will be about 4 magnitudes deeper than 2MASS and DENIS. The 5000 square degrees covered by the Dark Energy Survey (DES), another imaging survey scheduled to begin in 2010 at the CTIO 4 metre Blanco telescope, will also be observed in H-band. The area around both of the Galactic Caps will be observed in Y- and H- band as well to be combined with the data from the VST ATLAS survey. The main science drivers of the VHS include: examining low mass and nearby stars, studying the merger history of the Galaxy, measuring the properties of Dark Energy through the examination of large-scale structure to a redshift of ~1, and searches for high redshift quasars.

parameterDefinition.name: Query
parameterDefinition.description: Astronomy Data Query Language that defines the search criteria

parameterDefinition.name: RA column name
parameterDefinition.description: Name for input Right-Ascension column (or expression): column data in degrees

parameterDefinition.name: DEC column name
parameterDefinition.description: Name for input Declination column (or expression): column data in degrees

parameterDefinition.name: Find Mode
parameterDefinition.description: Find mode for matches: BEST or ALL

parameterDefinition.name: Input VOTable
parameterDefinition.description: Input VOTable, containing Right Ascension and Declination columns, for matching against
